children.subject: Thank you! I'll be taking 127 and 189 next year, so this is very useful. From reading this and other posts, I've come to the conclusion that the class can be self studied, and the main thing I'll get out of it is being more familiar with heavily used software for data science and getting more familiar with data visualization. Do you have any thoughts on replacing data 100 with ee120? Like what's the relative workload (given that I did very well in 16ab)?
Or, rather, do you have any recommendations for lower workload upper divs to use as a third tech?

Summary: 100 or 168 for lightest 3rd tech, i'd choose 168 for reasons above. Also, sleep, eat well, and exercise daily to keep up your energy and positive morale.

idk much about ee120. You can always search for a tech elective that's light. Data 100 is the best choice for balanced workload.

I've heard 1/2 people say 188 is a lot of work, and 1/2 say it's chill. There's a lot of reasons people complain about classes hah, so I can't really say if 188 would be a good 3rd tech. My friends who obsess over ML say 188 is a great class, while my other friends said it's worthless.

Mixed with personal experience and friend opinions: 162, 189, EECS 127/126, 170, 186(Hellerstein), 161, 168 are my personal recommendation courses, and I put them in order of difficulty/work. 160, 164, 169, 17x, 184, 188 imo are not necessary unless that class is your focus. 169 could be a great class if you take with Fox and you didn't learn the material via an internship.

In the end, all of these courses are a lot of work, so if you plan on taking 3 per semester, please make a priority to sleep the same time every night and get at least 7 hours. Also, hit the gym at least 20 minutes and eat as healthy as your budget lets you. Don't want to sound like Sahai or Tony Robbins, but the added energy will really help long term.

My perspective(Taken: Data 8): 

Summary: I don't think this class is worth if you can take EECS 127, CS 189. Self study the material. If you have time and space, it's a fun class to take.

Workload:
It's a great 3rd tech(Although 3 techs is never great). In terms of workload, there's 6 hws, 2 projects. You can drop 1 hw. If you drop the 6th hw, the only work from Spring Break until dead week is proj 2. Hws can take 1 hour if you know the material well, or 10-20 if you're stuck on multiple problems. With that being said, hw is very light. Proj is basically 1.5-2 hws in terms of length. The 1 midterm and 1 final were basically multiple choice, and if you learn more in depth than lecture notes(ie don't just memorize definitions and basic problems), you'll probably get a good grade. Also lab every week, takes an hour to complete and there's a TA there to help. You can also do the labs on your own.

Material:
From Jan all the way until late February, we learned pandas(python library to work with data), ways to create good visualizations, extract, clean, and manipulate data. I would imagine this being a great skill to learn if you want to work in data. Pandas is apparently heavily used in industry.

Along the way you learn very basic probability, SQL, and regex. I took 186, which I think helps you learn SQL better than data 100.

From March until end, you basically learn intro the ML, which was awesome since I knew basically nothing about it. The material was very difficult for me, but I didn't put as much effort in hindsight.

My friends perspective(Taken: EECS 127, ML research):
My friend knew Pandas, and the ML library we used. Also, EECS 127 goes in extreme depth of the 2nd half material. He said the class didn't teach ML well, and that it wasn't worth it.

Let me know if this long explanation is unclear. I put a summary on top in case you want the punchline.

history.content:
I took data100. Would not recommend. It's like a survey of "practical" data science skills that you can pretty much learn yourself, especially so if you had the chops to tackle 189. Time commitment is through buggy homeworks & projects, exams aren't too difficult.

Disclaimer: I'm biased because I believe I should've gotten a better grade but the instructors were unforgiving. However even though it's Hug in the fall I still think this class is not worth your time.

children.subject: tbh also nothing much to self study for... unless it's your first few upper divs.
Strongly agree with the student response. Grades were extremely unforgiving, exams pretty easy, and tons of busy work on piazza trying to explain inexplicable errors.

history.content: To those that have taken data 100, is it useful if I also take 189? Or should I consider a different class? I was thinking EE 120 as a backup, because I found the 16ab material interesting, but my career path will probably be SWE or maybe ML/AI related. What is the workload of 120 in comparison to data 100? I have a very hard schedule in fall, so I was looking for an interesting, lighter upper div course to compliment it.
history.subject: How useful is Data 100
